summary: This document is a sealed application and order from the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York, seeking a non-disclosure order for a grand jury subpoena served on Google, Inc. The subpoena requests records for accounts associated with the domain 'helpfulexperts.com' as part of a criminal investigation into suspected violations of mail and wire fraud statutes. The government argues that disclosure of the subpoena could jeopardize the investigation by alerting targets.

persons.name: Joon H. Kim
persons.role: Acting United States Attorney / Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Signs the grand jury subpoena and the accompanying letter to Google, and is the attorney submitting the application for the non-disclosure order.

persons.name: Andrew J. Peck
persons.context: Issues the 2705(b) Non-Disclosure Order, sealing the application and prohibiting Google from notifying the account holder about the subpoena.

events.title: Application for Non-Disclosure Order Filed
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney files an application under 18 U.S.C. § 2705(b) requesting a court order to prevent Google from notifying any person about a grand jury subpoena for 180 days.

events.title: Non-Disclosure Order Issued
events.description: Magistrate Judge Andrew J. Peck grants the government's application, issuing a sealed order prohibiting Google from disclosing the existence of the subpoena for 180 days.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Served on Google
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office serves a grand jury subpoena on Google, Inc., commanding the production of records related to accounts associated with the domain 'helpfulexperts.com' by July 21, 2017.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, New York, NY
Google, Inc., 1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA 94043
The Silvio J. Mollo Building (One St. Andrew's Plaza), New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The government obtained a sealed court order (17MAG5207) preventing Google from notifying any person, including the account holder, about a grand jury subpoena for 180 days.
The subpoena seeks all records for any accounts registered to or associated with the domain 'helpfulexperts.com', including subscriber information, payment details, and session logs.
The investigation involves suspected violations of federal mail and wire fraud statutes (18 U.S.C. §§ 1341, 1343).
The government argued that disclosure of the subpoena could seriously jeopardize the investigation by alerting targets, giving them an opportunity to flee, avoid prosecution, or tamper with evidence.
The document reveals an active, non-public criminal investigation in July 2017, where the account holder is suspected of being involved with persons under investigation.
